text: Paul Schlack (22 December 1897 - 19 August 1987) was a German chemist. He completed his studies at the Technical University of Stuttgart in 1921 and worked as a research chemist in Copenhagen for a year, before returning to Stuttgart. He received his PhD in 1924. Around this time he developed a keen interest in amide chemistry. He synthesized Nylon 6, widely known by its tradename Perlon, on 29 January 1938 whilst working for IG Farben. ==External links== * * Category:1897 births Category:1987 deaths Category:Polyamides Category:Synthetic fibers Category:German chemists Category:German inventors Category:Commanders Crosses of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany Category:Polymer scientists and engineers Category:Members of the German Academy of Sciences at Berlin Category:20th-century inventors Category:People educated at Eberhard-Ludwigs-Gymnasium Category:Scientists from Stuttgart
